questions.question_text_1: Consider the fundamental difference between a hard link and a symbolic link. Which statement best describes this difference?
question_texts: Consider the fundamental difference between a hard link and a symbolic link. Which statement best describes this difference?

options.option_text: A hard link contains a copy of the original file's data, while a symbolic link doesnot.
A hard link is essentially another name for the same file data (inode), while asymbolic link is a separate file containing the path to the original file.
Hard links can cross filesystem boundaries, whereas symbolic links cannot.
Hard links are exclusively used for pointing to directories, while symbolic linkscan only point to regular files.
Lines that contain "A" followed by any character, then "Z" anywhere on theline.
Lines that start with "A", have zero or more of any character (except newline)in between, and end with "Z".
Lines that contain either "A" or "Z" at the very beginning or very end of theline.
Lines that consist only of the characters "A" and "Z" with nothing in between.
